intro: Malvastrum multiflorum, commonly known as the mullein weed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides and in dry, sunny areas. Due to its rapid growth and invasive tendencies, it is considered a weed in many regions.
